intro: Maesa insularis, commonly known as the island maesa, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with evergreen leaves that are elliptical in shape. Its small, white flowers bloom in clusters and are often visited by pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Maesa insularis is adapted to thrive in moist, acidic soils and is often found in coastal or forested areas.
